definition: to be trapped/to be imprisoned
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
pitfall/trap/to get stuck/to sink/to cave in/to frame (false charge)/to capture (a city in battle)/to fall (to the enemy)/defect
thrown into prison/behind bars
to go to prison/to be imprisoned
fallen into a trap

sentences.english: You hurt my feelings by betraying me when I'm in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 你太傷我感情了，居然在我身陷困境之時背叛了我。

sentences.english: I’ve been in that situation lately.
sentences.chinese: 我不久前也曾身陷這樣的處境。

sentences.english: I sink in deep mire, where there is no foothold.
sentences.chinese: 我身陷泥潭中，找不到立足點。

sentences.english: Why is Saddam's oil minister still in prison?
sentences.chinese: 前薩達姆政府石油部長至今身陷囹圄爲哪般？

sentences.english: I wasn’t happy at that point. I felt trapped.
sentences.chinese: 當時我很不快樂，我感覺自己身陷困惑。

sentences.english: David found himself caught in a dangerous drama of pursuit in which King Saul tried to take his life.
sentences.chinese: 大衛發現自己身陷險境，掃羅王要取他的性命。

sentences.english: Your blog entangles you with the tentacles of the law.
sentences.chinese: 你的部落格讓你身陷麻煩的官司。

sentences.english: Because join underworld gang, kelina is thrown into jail to be sentenced 20 years.
sentences.chinese: 因爲加入幫會，柯里南身陷囹圄被判刑20年。

sentences.english: The smart-aleck rookie detective got himself in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 這個自作聰明的菜鳥偵探讓自己身陷危機。

sentences.english: House prices have fallen for five years, forcing many home owners into the negative equity pit.
sentences.chinese: 樓價連跌五年，不少業主身陷負資產困局。

sentences.english: Roh had been caught up in the corruption scandal and jumped to his death while he was hiking near his home.
sentences.chinese: 盧身陷賄賂醜聞，並在家附近徒步旅行時墜山死亡。

sentences.english: I like to say I was embedded with the Iraqi Republican Guard.
sentences.chinese: 我想說的是，我當時就身陷在伊拉克共和國衛隊中。

sentences.english: People often let situations control them instead of them controlling the situation.
sentences.chinese: 人們遇到情況時往往身陷被動局面，不能掌控形勢。

sentences.english: When we awake, we find ourselves at foreign land, and are besieged.
sentences.chinese: 當意識覺醒時，卻發現自己身首異處，身陷重圍。

sentences.english: Other news is that Caster Semenya is involved in Sex Entanglement.
sentences.chinese: 還有就是賽門亞身陷“性別門”。

sentences.english: When you first dive down to inspect them, though, it will appear as though you are shrouded in fog.
sentences.chinese: 當你首次潛入祕境探尋的時候，好似身陷迷霧。

definition: to be deeply in (trouble, debt etc)/deep set (eyes)
critical circumstances/risky conditions/danger zone
dangerous situation/venerable old age
to sink into/to get caught up in/to land in (a predicament)
swamp
quagmire
perilous situation
danger lurks on every side (idiom)
in (some place)/to be in (adversity, a difficult situation, danger, turmoil etc)/to find oneself in/placed in/surrounded by
caught in (a bad situation)/to fall into (trap etc)
lit. on all sides, the songs of Chu (idiom)/fig. surrounded by enemies, isolated and without help
predicament/plight
to be drawn into/to be involved in
desperate straits
to get away/to escape (from obligations)/to free oneself/to disengage
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
